column1: Alnavar is a panchayat town in the Dharwad district in Karnataka
column2: India. "Anilpur" was the ancient name of "Alnavar." C M Nimbannavar is the MLA of the town. It is known for its wood factory and wood industries. Being a small town it has a railway junction which comes under south western railway lines of India. Some of the places to visit are dandeli which has its own forest.

column1: Alnavar is located at 15.43°N 74.73°E﻿ / 15.43; 74.73. It has an average elevation of 563 metres (1847 feet). Trains from Bangalore to Vasco da Gama passes through this town.

column3: 286. Males constitute 51% of the population and females constitute 49%. Alnavar has an average literacy rate of 67%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%
column5: with 56% of the males and 44% of females literate. 13% of the population is under 6 years of age. Kannada
column6: Hindi & Marathi is the most widely spoken language.
